intro: Cremanthodium plantagineum var. maximowiczii, commonly known as the Maximowicz's cremanthodium, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in cool, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually basal, lanceolate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs. The flowers are small, yellowish, and clustered in a head, contributing to its ornamental appeal in alpine gardens.
